segments.text: Om Agyanati Miran Dasya Gyanan Janishalakaya Chakshurun Militam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Nama Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhakti Vedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatya Deshatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing from the 23rd verse of the 12th chapter.
The first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam.
Pita Maha Samas Samye Prasade Girishopamaha Ashraya Sarvabhutaanam Yatha Devo Ramashrayaha
The meaning of this verse is this child will be like his grandfather Yudhishthira or Brahma
in equanimity of mind.
He will be munificent like the lord of the Kailasha hill Shiva.
He will be like the lord of the Kailasha hill Shiva.
He will be the resort of everyone like the supreme personality of God at Narayana
who is even the shelter of the goddess of fortune.
So further description of the wonderful qualities of child Pariksit
are being given by the Brahmanas to King Yudhishthira.
So here three comparisons are made.
In mental equanimity,
he will be like his grandfather Yudhishthira or grandfather Brahma.
And in being munificent,
very generous,
he will be like lord Shiva.
And he will be the ultimate resort of everyone like lord Narayana
is the resort of everyone including goddess of fortune.
So Srila Prabhupada,
Srila Prabhupada has explained little elaborately in the purport
how these personalities who are referred to
are well known for their specific extraordinary qualities.
So Srila Prabhupada says in the purport,
mental equanimity refers both to Maharaj Yudhishthira and to Brahma,
the grandfather of all living beings.
According to Sridhar Swami,
one of the commentators on the Bhagavatam,
one of the previous Acharyas,
the grandfather referred to is Brahma.
How is Brahma the grandfather of all of us?
Brahma's son,
Swayambhuva Manu,
that Swayambhuva Manu is the father of mankind.
So all human beings
have Swayambhuva Manu as their father
and Swayambhuva Manu's father
is Brahma.
Therefore Brahma is the grandfather of all human beings.
In that way,
Brahma is referred to as the grandfather
in this particular comparison.
Pitamaha Samaha Samye.
And then according to Srila Vishwanachakruti Thakur,
another great Acharya,
previous Acharya in our Sampradaya,
he has written a commentary on the Bhagavatam.
Srila Vishwanachakruti Thakur says,
the grandfather referred to here
is Maharaj Yudhishthira himself.
Now Srila Prabhupada says,
of course Yudhishthira is the grandfather of Pariksit.
Pariksit's father is Abhimanyu.
Abhimanyu is the son of Arjuna
and Arjuna's brother, Yudhishthira.
So therefore Yudhishthira is in the position
of the grandfather of child Pariksit.
Now Srila Prabhupada says something very interesting.
In both cases, the comparison is equally good
because both of them are recognized representatives
of the Supreme Lord.
Both Brahma and Yudhishthira
are recognized representatives of the Supreme Lord.
Thus both of them have to maintain mental equanimity
being engaged in welfare work for the living being.
Brahma is engaged in the welfare
of all the living beings in the whole universe.
That is Brahma's position.
And Yudhishthira, as the emperor of the world,
he was always engaged in welfare work
of the citizens of the whole world.
So Srila Prabhupada says,
to be able to do welfare work,
any responsible executive agent
at the top of administration
has to tolerate different types of onslaughts
from the very persons for whom he works.
Example is given by Srila Prabhupada.
Brahma was criticized even by the gopis,
the highest perfectional devotees
of the Supreme Lord Krishna.
The gopis were divided.
The gopis were dissatisfied with the work of Brahma
because Brahma as creator of this particular universe
created eyelids which obstructed their seeing Lord Krishna.
How were the eyelids obstructing our seeing?
That Prabhupada explains,
they could not tolerate,
the gopis could not tolerate a moment's blinking of the eyes
for it kept them from seeing their beloved Lord Krishna.
When you blink,
you have to keep blinking the eyes.
So when you blink,
for a moment,
we are not able to see
the object of affection.
So the gopis felt that
why has Brahma created these eyelids
which momentarily stop us from seeing Krishna.
So what to speak of others
who are naturally very critical
of every aspect of life.
The action of a responsible man.
Even the gopis, the perfectional devotees,
they criticise Brahma
for making these eyelids
which block their vision of Krishna.
So what to speak of others?
So the conclusion is
that anyone in a position of responsibility
has to have that equanimity of mind
to do the welfare work
in spite of criticism
from the very people whom they are...
from the very people whom they are...
from the very people whom they are...
they are trying to do welfare activity. Similarly, Maharaj Yudhishthira had to cross
over many difficult situations created by his enemies and he proved to be the most perfect
maintainer of mental equanimity in all critical circumstances. So, both are fitting comparisons
for equanimity of mind. The next Lord Shiva is described. Lord Shiva is a celebrated demigod
who awards gifts to beggars. His name is therefore Ashutosh or one who is very easily pleased.
He is also called Bhutanatha or the lord of the common folk who are mainly attached to him
because of his munificent gifts even without consideration of the after effects.
Shiva is liberal in giving gifts to whoever approaches him
and begs for some particular benediction. Shiva liberally gives that. So, it is described here
by Srila Prabhupada that Ravana was very attached to Lord Shiva and by easily pleasing him,
Ravana became so powerful and he wanted to challenge the authority of Lord Rama.
By Ravana's grace,
Ravana became very visible and powerful. Lord Rama's grace was so great that
Ravana became powerful. And he misused this power in challenging Lord Rama. Ravana was
never helped by Lord Shiva when Ravana was fighting against Rama. Because the Supreme
Lord is not only Lord of everyone, he is also the Lord of Shiva. So when the battle was
going on between Ravana and Rama, Shiva could not help Ravana. Then once Shiva awarded
a benediction to one Asura by name Vrikasura. And this benediction was an awkward benediction
and it was also very disturbing. Vrikasura became empowered by the grace of Lord Shiva
to vanquish Ravana.
Anyone's head simply by touching the head. This is the benediction that Vrikasura asked
Shiva. Whosoever head I touch, that person's head should immediately get cut off. Just
by its touch. So Shiva knew that this Asura is going to misuse this benediction. So when
Shiva was refusing to give such a horrible benediction, then Vrikasura became very very
restless.
And he started cutting off the portions of flesh, his own flesh, and offering it to Shiva
in sacrifice. So Shiva took compassion upon this foolish Asura and stopped him from killing
himself in that way. And then Shiva had to give this stubborn Asura, Vrikasura, the benediction
he wanted.
Then what did he do? What did he do? What did he do? What did he do? What did he do? What
did this fellow do? This Vrikasura, after he got the benediction. Although Shiva was
the one who gave him the benediction, this cunning Asura, he wanted to make an experiment
of the power of this benediction by touching the head of Lord Shiva. Thus Lord Shiva had
to take shelter of Vishnu to save himself from this trouble. And Lord Vishnu, what did
Vrikasura do? When Vrikasura went chasing, then Shiva took shelter of Vishnu and Vishnu
confronted this Vrikasura. And by the illusory energy called Yogamaya, Vishnu was able to
ask Vrikasura to make an experiment of this benediction by touching his own head. And,

So, Vrikasura under the illusion, he touched his own head to test whether the benediction is actually working or not. And in this way, Vishnu saved the whole world from the trouble being created by this cunning beggar of the demigods.

So, why Prabhupada is narrating all this is because Lord Shiva never denies anyone any sort of gift. He is very liberal. He is therefore the most generous among the givers of benediction. Shiva is the most generous.
Although, sometimes some kind of mistake also happens in granting benediction.
Then the next description is,
about Lord Vishnu. It is described here, Rama means the goddess of fortune.
Yatha Devo Rama Shrayah.
And her shelter, Rama Devi or Lakshmi Devi, her shelter is Lord Vishnu. Lord Vishnu is the maintainer of all living beings.
There are innumerable living beings, not only on the surface of this planet.
But also in all other hundreds of thousands of planets in this universe.
All of them are provided with all necessities of life for the progressive march towards the end of self-realization.
The Upanishads say,
Eko bahunam yo vidadhati kaman.
That is the position of the Supreme Lord Vishnu or Krishna.
That it is only the Supreme Lord who maintains all living beings.
But, in spite of this protection by the Lord,
Srila Prabhupada says,
On the path of sense gratification,
these living beings are put into difficulty by the agency of Maya, the illusory energy.
When we violate the laws of nature or laws of God,
and we encroach on somebody else's property,
or we give trouble to others unnecessarily,
then the illusory energy actually punishes such wrongdoers.
And it's only under illusion that the living beings who are desirous of enjoying this material world,
they are traversing the path of a false plan of economic development.
Such economic development is never successful because it is illusory.
So, instead of seeking directly the protection of the goddess of fortune,
one should seek the protection of Vishnu.
Because, even the goddess of fortune is sheltered by Vishnu.
And therefore, Srila Prabhupada says,
Only Vishnu or his pure devotee can give protection to everyone.
And therefore, it is predicted that Pariksit Maharaj,
who was protected by Vishnu,
himself would give all protection to people who wanted to live under his rule.
In this way, it is being predicted about Pariksit.
I'll stop here. Thank you very much. Hare Krishna.
